summary_gpt: Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited has submitted its audited standalone and consolidated financial statements for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2025, as per regulatory requirements. The filings include the results and auditor reports, with details available on the company's website.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited has re-approved a rights issue of up to Rs. 3,000 crore and is scheduled to hold a board meeting on May 8, 2025, to finalize details such as issue price and terms. The company is seeking regulatory approval and intends to proceed with the rights issue under new regulations.

The company has re-approved a rights issue of up to Rs. 3,000 crore to strengthen its capital adequacy ratio and support growth plans, superseding the previous approval from February 2025. The new approval aligns with recent SEBI regulations and does not alter the original issue size or purpose.

The company has re-approved a rights issue of up to Rs. 3,000 crore to strengthen its capital adequacy ratio, superseding the previous approval from February 2025, and will proceed under the simplified SEBI regulations. The fundraise aims to support the company's growth and asset management plans, with details on the record date and pricing to be announced later.

The company has re-approved a rights issue of up to Rs. 3,000 crore to strengthen its capital adequacy ratio, superseding the previous approval from February 2025, and will proceed under the new simplified SEBI regulations. The rights issue aims to support the company's growth and asset management expansion plans.

The company has re-approved a rights issue of up to Rs. 3,000 crore to strengthen its capital adequacy ratio, superseding the previous approval from February 2025, and will proceed under the new simplified SEBI regulations. The rights issue aims to support the company's growth and asset management expansion plans.

The company is seeking re-approval from the board for a Rs. 3,000 crore rights issue of equity shares, initially approved in February 2025, to strengthen its capital base and support growth plans, in compliance with recent SEBI regulatory amendments. The re-approval is necessary due to new simplified regulations that came into effect on April 8, 2025, which streamline the rights issue process.

The filing contains the transcript of Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited's Q4 FY 2025 earnings conference call held on April 22, 2025, discussing the company's financial performance and outlook. It includes management insights and responses to analyst questions, with the transcript made available on the company's investor relations website.

The filings confirm that Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited processed dematerialization requests for securities and reported no requests for equity share dematerialization during Q4 2024. KFin Technologies Limited provided certification of these activities to the company and regulators, ensuring compliance with SEBI regulations.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services received a Rs. 71.30 lakh penalty from RBI for non-compliance with certain KYC and fair practice norms, following an inspection and subsequent show cause notice. The company has taken corrective actions and remains committed to compliance, with no impact on its operations beyond the financial penalty.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Ltd. announced reaffirmed credit ratings from CRISIL for various instruments, including AAA/Stable for long-term debt and A1+ for short-term debt, with some ratings withdrawn due to redemption. The ratings reaffirmation indicates continued strong creditworthiness and stability of the company's debt profile.

The company has announced a record date of 15th July 2025 for the dividend payment of Rs. 6.50 per share, contingent upon approval at the upcoming AGM on 22nd July 2025. This follows the board's earlier recommendation for the dividend for the financial year ended 31st March 2025.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited announced the publication of its audited financial statements for FY 2024-25 in newspapers, complying with SEBI regulations, with details available on their website. The financial results have also been uploaded online for investor access.

The filings include Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited's revised financial results for FY 2024-25 due to an inadvertent error, along with the approval of a dividend of Rs. 6.50 per share for the same period, as announced in their Board meeting held on April 22, 2025.

The filings include Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited's revised financial results for FY 2024-25, along with the approval of a dividend of Rs. 6.50 per share and details of the Board meeting outcomes. The company also confirmed the unmodified audit reports and the appointment of company secretaries, indicating compliance and positive financial disclosures.

The filing informs that Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited has uploaded the audio recording of its earnings conference call for Q4 and FY2025, held on April 22, 2025, to its official website as per regulatory requirements.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited reported a 33% increase in Profit After Tax for FY25, with a 17% growth in its loan book and stable asset quality. The company also proposed a final dividend of Rs. 6.50 per share, reflecting confidence in its financial position.

The company has announced the elevation of Mr. ShivKumar N V to Chief Business Officer - Small & Medium Enterprises, effective from May 1, 2025, as part of its management restructuring. This change highlights a focus on expanding and diversifying its SME business segment.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited has appointed M/s. Makarand M. Joshi & Co. as its new secretarial auditor, replacing M/s. KSR & Co., with the change effective from April 22, 2025, pending shareholder approval at the upcoming AGM. The new appointment is for a five-year term from April 23, 2025, to April 2029, to conduct secretarial audits and related services.

The company has approved the re-appointment of Dr. Rebecca Nugent as an Independent Director for a second term of five years, subject to shareholder approval, with the re-appointment effective from March 2026. This disclosure details the appointment process, her profile, and the regulatory compliance involved.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Ltd. announced its audited financial results for FY 2024-25, recommended a dividend of Rs. 6.50 per share, and approved an increase in borrowing limits to Rs. 1,50,000 crore, along with other financial and operational disclosures. The company also confirmed the unmodified audit opinions and outlined plans for fund-raising through NCDs.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Ltd. announced its audited financial results for FY 2024-25, along with a proposed dividend of Rs. 6.50 per share, subject to shareholder approval, and increased its borrowing limit to Rs. 1,50,000 crore. The company also confirmed the utilization of proceeds from recent NCD issuances and received approval for various financial and operational measures.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Ltd. announced its audited financial results for FY 2024-25, along with a proposed dividend of Rs. 6.50 per share, subject to shareholder approval, and increased its borrowing limit to Rs. 1,50,000 crore. The company also confirmed the utilization of proceeds from recent NCD issuances and received approval for various financial and operational measures.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited reported a 33% increase in Profit After Tax for FY25, with a 17% growth in its loan book and steady asset quality. The company also announced a final dividend of Rs. 6.50 per share, reflecting confidence in its financial stability.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services reported a 2% YoY increase in AUM to Rs 15,530 crores and a 33% YoY rise in PAT to Rs 2,345 crores for FY25, with improved asset quality and disbursement growth. The company highlighted operational efficiencies and digital initiatives during the earnings presentation for the quarter ending March 2025.

Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited announced its audited financial results for FY 2024-25, recommended a dividend of Rs. 6.50 per share, and approved an increase in borrowing limits from Rs. 1,30,000 crore to Rs. 1,50,000 crore, along with other corporate approvals.
